result.execSummary:
The defendant Rayveon T Davis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rayveon T Davis

records.addlTxt:
9:52 AM Defendant Rayveon T Davis in court.  Attorney Rachel Allison Robole in court for Rayveon T Davis.  Prosecuting Attorney Afton Brianna Lewis in court for the State of Wisconsin. The parties have an agreement. 
Defendant enters a no contest plea to Count 2: Possession of THC. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. Court accepts plea and finds the defendant guilty. 
Court orders: court costs and applicable surcharges and DNA sample.

Condititions: 
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level.

9:44 AM case called. Defendant Rayveon T Davis in court.  Attorney Rachel Allison Robole in court for Rayveon T Davis.  Prosecuting attorney Afton Brianna Lewis Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Warrant is quashed. Signature bond amount is increased. 
Return to court: 10/26/22 at 9:30 am.

Conditions: 
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level.

10:00 AM Defendant Rayveon T Davis not in court.  Attorney Rachel Allison Robole in court for Rayveon T Davis.  Prosecuting attorney Afton Brianna Lewis in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Robole does not have any information on her client's whereabouts. Warrant ordered; $50 or body only.

9:40 AM case called. Prosecuting Attorney Afton Brianna Lewis in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Rayveon T Davis in court with Attorney Rachel Allison Robole.
Warrant quashed, bond continues.

Attorney Robole states she is awaiting on discovery and requests a new date.
Hearing scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 09:30 am.

9:52 AM case called. Prosecuting Attorney Monica A Fallon in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Rayveon T Davis not in court.  Attorney Rachel Allison Robole in court for Rayveon T Davis. State requests warrant.
Warrant ordered.
